result.execSummary:
The defendant Larona S Bandy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CASH BAIL APPLIED. REMAINDER RETURNED TO POSTER.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Larona S Bandy in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting attorney moves to amend charge to Theft contrary to ordinance 13-102(c)(12), Waukesha County Ordinances. Court approves amendment. No contest plea entered.  

The Court Orders the Following:	

FORFEITURE: $456.50 - CASH BAIL POSTED TO BE APPLIED FROM THIS CASE AND 18CM407.

Case 18CM407 is dismissed and read in to this case.
